New Records: Ja Morant recorded his 12th career triple-double with 26 points, 10 rebounds, and 14 assists in the Memphis Grizzlies' 122-99 win over the Milwaukee Bucks
Key Match Events: Morant scored 21 points in the first half, helping Memphis build a 70-48 lead
The Grizzlies never allowed the Bucks to come within 18 points in the second half
Pre-Game Insights: Morant emphasized being aggressive and taking what the defense allows
Memphis focused on strong defense and perimeter play
Post-Match Reflections: Morant praised the team's effort and rhythm
Bucks coach Doc Rivers acknowledged the team's spirit but noted the absence of Middleton's impact
Miscellaneous Highlights: Khris Middleton's injury was a significant factor for the Bucks
